description: Request, approve, deny or cancel a domain transfer.
availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: TransferDomain
Domain Name
Order action:CREATE - create a transfer orderREPLACE - replace a transfer orderUPDATE - update a transfer order

Application order ID. Will only be taken into consideration if parameter ORDER is set to REPLACE or UPDATE. If parameter is not stated and order is REPLACE or UPDATE an auto detection will be carried out to detect the right order
Auth-Info code, required for some TLDs.

Action, may be one of the following (default value is REQUEST):REQUEST: Request a transfer-in from another registrarUSERTRANSFER: Request a usertransfer (internal transfer)CANCEL: Cancel a requested transfer-inAPPROVE: Approve a requested transfer-outDENY: Deny a requested transfer-out
paramaters.Type: REQUEST, APPROVE, DENY, CANCEL or USERTRANSFER

paramaters.Definition: Domain name and authorization code provided as one parameter; must have the form "DOMAIN AUTH"
The class of the domain name if it is a premium domain

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. This parameter specifies the language of this email. If the desired language is not available, the English version of the email will be sent. Currently the following languages are available for gTLD transfers:en_US: Englishde_DE: German and Englishsv_SE: Swedish and English The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/emaillanguage".

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. This email can include a confirmation link allowing the recipient to confirm the domain transfer. The URL for this link can be specified by this parameter. You can use the following place holders which will be replaced accordingly:{ACTION}: transfer operation{DOMAIN}: domain that is supposed to get transferred{TRIGGER}: trigger code through which the email recipient is validated{LANGUAGE}: the language of the confirmation page (Same value as EMAILLANGUAGE)The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/url"If this parameter is not specified and the respective environment key does not exists for the user account the following URL will be taken which leads to our whitelabel confirmation page: http://icann-transfers.info/?domain={DOMAIN}&action={ACTION}&trigger={TRIGGER}&form_language={LANGUAGE}

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. This email can contain a link to the Terms and Conditions of the new registrar/reseller. The link to those Terms and Conditions can be specified with this parameter. The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/tac"

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. Since an email with a foreign sender address is much more likely to be considered spam, only the reply-to address of the email may be specified using this parameter. The default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/emailsender"

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. The subject of this email can be specified by this parameter. It may contain the following place holders which will be replaced accordingly:{ACTION}: transfer operation{DOMAIN}: domain that is supposed to get transferred{TRIGGER}: trigger code through which the email recipient is validatedThe default value comes from the environment key "_system/gtld/transfer/emailsubject"

For some registries/TLDs an email is sent during the domain transfer process. When this parameter is used, the system checks if the provided email address matches one of those email addresses to which the email will be sent. If it does not, the command will fail.
Organization requesting the transfer. The default value comes from the environment key  "user-info/contact/company/organization".
Nameservers assigned to the domain after the transfer is finished
Nameserver hostnames and IP addresses
The account in which the domain will be located after the transfer is finished
Period the domain will be renewed during the transfer process. If not stated a default period will be queried.
Contact Handle ID
Contact Handle ID
Contact Handle ID
Contact Handle ID
If set to 1, a transfer lock will be set for the domain upon successful transfer. If set to 0, the domain will remain unlocked after the transfer. By default this value is set to 1 for all TLDs.
Creates the necessary dns zone before submitting application to the registry.
Repository in which the domain will be located after the transfer is finished
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions of the registration

Activates the trustee service
Activate the trustee service for a .DE domain

Abuse contact information for the domain that will be displayed by the registry. Value must consist of a valid URI template string, either a mailto link (e.g. mailto:contact@example.com ) or a valid http/https URL (e.g. https://mycontactform.example). If not given the domain will keep the currently set Abuse contact

General request contact information for the domain that will be displayed by the registry. Value must consist of a valid URI template string, either a mailto link (e.g. mailto:contact@example.com ) or a valid http/https URL (e.g. https://mycontactform.example). If not given the domain will keep the currently set General request contact
Activate the trustee service for a .EU domain
Citizenship of the registrant. Only relevant for natural persons with an European citizenship residing outside of the EU
paramaters.Type: at, be, bg, cz, cy, de, dk, es, ee, fi, fr, gr, hu, ie, it, lt, lu, lv, mt, nl, pl, pt, ro, se, sk, si or hr

paramaters.Definition: Registrant's personal or organizational identification number; only relevant for .FI domains
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions
Type of company applying for an .FI domain; possible values:0: Private person1: Company (default)2: Association3: Foundation4: Municipality5: Political party6: State7: Public corporation
Set to 1 in order to indicate that the domain name is based on the personal or company name of the registrant; only relevant for .FI domains
The register where the company name on which the domain name is based has been registered; only relevant for .FI domains
The registration number of the registered company name on which the domain name is based; only relevant for .FI domains
Set to 1 to accept the .FR transfer terms and conditions
Set to 1 to disclose the administrators's details
Setting this parameter to 1 discloses the registrant's details
Companies with a European trademark can additionally add their trademark number using this parameter
Legal form of the entity (in case registrant is not a natural person)
Other form than the possible values of the above parameter
Companies having their head office in the territory of the European Union must provide their VAT-ID with this parameter
The date of declaration of the association
The number of the Journal Officiel
The page of the announcement in the Journal Officiel
The date of publication in the Journal Officiel

The DUNS number is a nine-digit number, issued by Dun & Bradstreet. DUNS is the abbreviation of Data Universal Numbering System. Companies with a valid DUNS number are still obliged having their head office in the territory of the European Union. The DUNS number can be provided using this parameter
Companies with a local identifier specific to a country of the European Economic Area can provide their local identifier using this parameter
Activates the trustee service

If the registrant is an individual the PIN has to be either the registrant's fiscal code or the number of an idenity document. For organizations the PIN has to be the company's fiscal code or the company's VAT-ID
Activate the trustee service for a .IT domain

In some special cases you need to specify the exact entity type of the registrant:1: Italian and foreign natural persons2: Italian Companies / one man companies3:  freelance workers / professionals 4: non-profit organizations5: public organizations6: other subjects7: foreigners who match 2 - 6
State if you agree to the .IT Consent for Publishing
Accepts - "Section 6 - Consent to the processing of personal data for diffusion and accessibility via the internet"
The nationality of the registrant contact if it deviates from the country code

The company registration number has to be provided with this parameter if the registrant is a organization from Singapore

Customer handle; only relevant for .TO domains
Must be one of the following: P1: Business use for profit P2: Non-profit business, club, association, religious organization, etc.P3: Personal use P4: Education purposes  P5: Government purposes

Must be one of the following: C11: a United States citizen C12: a permanent resident of the United States of America or any of its posessions or territories.  C21: U.S. Organization incorporated within one of the 50 states or a U.S. Territory An entity or organization that has a bona fide presence in the United States of America or any of its possessions or territories. C31:  Regularly engages in lawful activities (sales of goods or services or other business, commercial or non-commercial, including not-for-profit relations in the United States)  C32: Entity has an office or other facility in the US.
Specify the two-letter country-code of the registrant (if Nexus Category is either C31 or C32)
The "Unique Identification Number" which entitles the owner to be a registrant of a .TRAVEL domain
